attributes.action: Introduce a 'teacher panel' for all government education decisions
attributes.additional_details:
The new KS2 tests focus on grammar, reading and maths.  The concepts are so specific that creative writing, critical thinking, art and other subjects are likely to be cut as teachers scramble to spend more time drilling students.

Teachers are aware that testing does not work.  A varied, rich, creative curriculum does.  We have ideas.  Why are we not being consulted?

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-views/take-absurdly-difficult-english-test-and-see-why-generation-students
attributes.background:
The new Key Stage 2 tests show an incredible lack of foresight and knowledge of education today.  

This petition calls for the government to consult a randomly-selected range of teachers from across the UK whenever it wants to make changes to education policy.
